intro: Pavonia longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-pedunculate pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, often arranged in clusters at the ends of long, slender peduncles. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. Pavonia longipedunculata is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks.
